definition: to limp/to sprain (an ankle or wrist)/to move carefully, as if evading a danger/to scurry
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: How could the critics praise such a rhymer?
sentences.chinese: 评论家们怎么能赞扬这样一个蹩脚的诗人？

sentences.english: Okay, so enough with the lame analogy for now.
sentences.chinese: 好了，这个蹩脚的类比到现在已经足够了。

sentences.english: Allow yourself to write a crappy first draft.
sentences.chinese: 允许自己写一份蹩脚的初稿。

sentences.english: This is a giant, lame load of BS.
sentences.chinese: 这是一句蹩脚的大废话。

sentences.english: This painting has vivid colours but poor composition.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画色彩鲜明，但布局蹩脚。

sentences.english: The LCD screen has a crappy, thin plastic cover.
sentences.chinese: 液晶显示屏幕上有一个蹩脚的，薄的塑料盖。

sentences.english: What a pity I left it at home.
sentences.chinese: 真蹩脚，我把它记正在家里了。

sentences.english: Washed-up band, crappy so-called art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 失败的乐队，蹩脚的所谓艺术画廊。

sentences.english: This is a giant, lame4) load of BS5).
sentences.chinese: 这是一句蹩脚的大废话。

sentences.english: The ham actor was ham-fisted after he took a slice of ham.
sentences.chinese: 蹩脚演员吃完一片火腿肉之后变得笨手笨脚。

sentences.english: Now be honest with me; how many times have you heard that lame line?
sentences.chinese: 不过说实话，这样蹩脚的赞词你听了多少次了？

sentences.english: His verse has the sing-song rhythm of a poetaster .
sentences.chinese: 他的诗句有着蹩脚诗人的单调的节律。

sentences.english: The world is a stage, but the play is badly cast.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界是个舞台，但角色被合配得很蹩脚。

sentences.english: His broken English showed he was a foreigner.
sentences.chinese: 他的蹩脚的英语说明他是一个外国人。

sentences.english: When people speak in broken English, they often leave out small words.
sentences.chinese: 当人们说蹩脚英语时，他们经常省略了一些小词。

sentences.english: Does Linkin Park's new album suck?
sentences.chinese: 林肯公园新专辑很蹩脚？

definition: unable to make sense of what one is hearing
strange accent/odd manner of speaking or singing
Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
(of singing or speaking) very articulate pronunciation and vocalizing
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
